result.execSummary:
The defendant Faith E Rex was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs on each count. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact direct or indirect with victim.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: 5 days of sentence are stayed, to be used to discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections. Huber privileges granted. 60 days to report. Applies to both counts.
Perform 15 hours of uncompensated community service for non-profit agency.

Door County Restitution Summary

Defendant Faith E Rex in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, reviews Victim Impact Statement. Discussion regarding Count 2. Court finds Defendant guilty of Count 2. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
for DNA sample

Defendant Faith E Rex in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1, withholds guilty finding on Count 2 (which may be dismissed and read in if she pays restitution up front). Count 3 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. Court orders DNA sample. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Faith Rex appears in person with Atty Lee Shuchart who appears by phone for Atty Gerbers. Joan Korb appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions where matter is at. Atty Schuchart indicates matter is to be left on the trial calendar. Since this case is the older case on the trial calendar, it will be in the #1 position.  Court questions whether any pretrial orders need to be set, would like any motions filed sooner rather than later. Atty Schuchert will have Atty Gerbers supply State with witness list and file any motions/proposed jury instructions with the court . State indicates it will only be a one day trial. Court would like to know by noon on Friday, 9/23/16 if matter is resolved. bond remains in effect.
Pre-trial conference on September 12, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on September 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on July 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Faith E Rex in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Originally set for plea/sentencing. Defense requests trial and pretrial to force an end date. Set for trial and pre-trial.

Defendant Faith E Rex in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of meeting with Defendant, has a few more things to cover.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Faith E Rex in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises that he hasn't been able to meet with Defendant, is meeting with her tomorrow, requests rescheduling. Court questions Defendant, who has not made any payments, has been off work, going to doctors constantly to try to figure out what's going on.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Faith E Rex in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of offer that involves payment of restitution, requests plea/sentencing about 90 days out.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Faith E Rex in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Maciolek advises that Atty Gerbers will be handling file. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense enters not guilty pleas. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 10/29/15.
No contact direct or indirect with RB or his resident at 4289 S. Countryview Rd, Sturgeon Bay. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.
Door County Jail

Defendant Faith E Rex appeared by video. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared in Court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 11/9/15, 10:00.
